panels.description: This report contains charts displaying resources usage measurements (Number of Virtual Machines, CPU, Memory, Network Tx/Rx) for a selected host over the selected period.

targets.rawSql:
-- BR2C - This query returns the hosts
-- Max and Average Active VMs Counts by hour of day and day of week

SELECT
    now() AS time,
    CASE $period_id
        WHEN 1 THEN 
        CASE CAST(num AS int)
            WHEN 1 THEN 'Sunday'
            WHEN 2 THEN 'Monday'
            WHEN 3 THEN 'Tuesday'
            WHEN 4 THEN 'Wednesday'
            WHEN 5 THEN'Thursday'
            WHEN 6 THEN 'Friday'
            WHEN 7 THEN 'Saterday'
       END
            WHEN 2 THEN num
    END AS num,
    vms_num AS "Avg. Number of VMs"
FROM (
    SELECT DISTINCT
        CASE $period_id
            WHEN 1
               THEN to_char(time, 'D')
            WHEN 2
              THEN to_char(time, 'HH24:00') 
        END AS num,
        AVG ( VMS ) AS "vms_num"
    --    AVG ( VMS_Peak ) AS "Avg. VMs Peak"
    FROM (
        -- Here we get the hosts Max and Average CPU Usage Peaks
        SELECT
            history_datetime AS time,
            SUM (
                COALESCE (
                    active_vms,
                    0
                ) *
                COALESCE (
                    minutes_in_status,
                    0
                )
            ) /
            SUM (
                COALESCE (
                    minutes_in_status,
                    0
                )
            ) AS VMS,
            SUM (
                COALESCE (
                    max_active_vms,
                    0
                ) *
                COALESCE (
                    minutes_in_status,
                    0
                )
            ) /
            SUM (
                COALESCE (
                    minutes_in_status,
                    0
                )
            ) AS VMS_Peak
        FROM
           (
            SELECT * FROM v4_3_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_hourly
            UNION
            SELECT * FROM v4_3_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_daily
           ) AS hourly_daily
        WHERE
            -- Here we filter by active hosts only
            hourly_daily.host_status = 1
            -- Here we filter by the host chosen by the user
            AND hourly_daily.host_id in ($host_id)
            AND history_datetime >= $__timeFrom()
            AND history_datetime < $__timeTo()
        GROUP BY
            history_datetime
    ) AS a
    GROUP BY
        CASE $period_id
            WHEN 1
               THEN to_char(time, 'D')
            WHEN 2
              THEN to_char(time, 'HH24:00') 
        END
    ORDER BY
        CASE $period_id
            WHEN 1
               THEN to_char(time, 'D')
            WHEN 2
              THEN to_char(time, 'HH24:00') 
        END ASC
) as b

-- BR2C - This query returns the hosts

    --    AVG ( VMS ) AS "vms_num"
        AVG ( VMS_Peak ) AS vms_peak

        -- Here we get the hosts Max and Average CPU Usage Peaks

            history_datetime AS time,

                COALESCE (
                    active_vms,
                    0
                ) *
                COALESCE (
                    minutes_in_status,
                    0
                )
            ) /
            SUM (
                COALESCE (
                    minutes_in_status,
                    0
                )
            ) AS VMS,
            SUM (
                COALESCE (
                    max_active_vms,
                    0
                ) *
                COALESCE (
                    minutes_in_status,
                    0
                )
            ) /
            SUM (
                COALESCE (
                    minutes_in_status,
                    0
                )
            ) AS VMS_Peak
        FROM
           (
            SELECT * FROM v4_3_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_hourly
            UNION
            SELECT * FROM v4_3_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_daily
           ) AS hourly_daily
        WHERE
            -- Here we filter by active hosts only
            hourly_daily.host_status = 1
            -- Here we filter by the host chosen by the user
            AND hourly_daily.host_id in ($host_id)
            AND history_datetime >= $__timeFrom()

        GROUP BY
            history_datetime
    ) AS a

        CASE $period_id
            WHEN 1
               THEN to_char(time, 'D')

        END
    ORDER BY
        CASE $period_id
            WHEN 1
               THEN to_char(time, 'D')
            WHEN 2
              THEN to_char(time, 'HH24:00') 
        END ASC
) as b

panels.title: Number of Virtual Machines Peaks  (BR2C)

panels.description: This report contains charts displaying resources usage measurements (Number of Virtual Machines, CPU, Memory, Network Tx/Rx) for a selected host over the selected period.

targets.rawSql:
-- BR2C - This query returns the hosts
-- Max and Average CPU Usage Peaks by hour of day and day of week

SELECT
    now() AS time,
    CASE $period_id
        WHEN 1 THEN 
        CASE CAST(num AS int)
            WHEN 1 THEN 'Sunday'
            WHEN 2 THEN 'Monday'
            WHEN 3 THEN 'Tuesday'
            WHEN 4 THEN 'Wednesday'
            WHEN 5 THEN'Thursday'
            WHEN 6 THEN 'Friday'
            WHEN 7 THEN 'Saterday'
       END
            WHEN 2 THEN num
    END AS num,
    cpu_usage AS "CPU Usage"
FROM (
    SELECT DISTINCT
        CASE $period_id
            WHEN 1
               THEN to_char(time, 'D')
            WHEN 2
              THEN to_char(time, 'HH24:00') 
        END AS num,
        AVG ( CPU_Usage ) AS cpu_usage
    --    AVG ( CPU_Peak ) AS CPU_Peak
    FROM (
        -- Here we get the hosts Max and Average CPU Usage Peaks
        SELECT
            history_datetime AS time,
            SUM (
                COALESCE (
                    cpu_usage_percent,
                    0
                ) *
                COALESCE (
                    minutes_in_status,
                    0
                )
            ) /
            SUM (
                COALESCE (
                    minutes_in_status,
                    0
                )
            ) AS CPU_Usage,
            SUM (
                COALESCE (
                    max_cpu_usage,
                    0
                ) *
                COALESCE (
                    minutes_in_status,
                    0
                )
            ) /
            SUM (
                COALESCE (
                    minutes_in_status,
                    0
                )
            ) AS CPU_Peak
        FROM
           (
            SELECT * FROM v4_3_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_hourly
            UNION
            SELECT * FROM v4_3_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_daily
           ) AS hourly_daily
        WHERE
            -- Here we filter by active hosts only
            hourly_daily.host_status = 1
            -- Here we filter by the host chosen by the user
            AND hourly_daily.host_id in ($host_id)
            AND history_datetime >= $__timeFrom()
            AND history_datetime < $__timeTo()
        GROUP BY
            history_datetime
    ) AS a
    GROUP BY
        CASE $period_id
            WHEN 1
               THEN to_char(time, 'D')
            WHEN 2
              THEN to_char(time, 'HH24:00') 
        END
    ORDER BY
        CASE $period_id
            WHEN 1
               THEN to_char(time, 'D')
            WHEN 2
              THEN to_char(time, 'HH24:00') 
        END ASC
) AS b

panels.title: Average CPU Usage Peaks (BR2C)

panels.description: This report contains charts displaying resources usage measurements (Number of Virtual Machines, CPU, Memory, Network Tx/Rx) for a selected host over the selected period.

targets.rawSql:
-- BR2C - This query returns the hourly hosts
-- Max and Average Memory Usage Peaks by hour of day and day of week

SELECT
    now() AS time,
    CASE $period_id
        WHEN 1 THEN 
        CASE CAST(num AS int)
            WHEN 1 THEN 'Sunday'
            WHEN 2 THEN 'Monday'
            WHEN 3 THEN 'Tuesday'
            WHEN 4 THEN 'Wednesday'
            WHEN 5 THEN'Thursday'
            WHEN 6 THEN 'Friday'
            WHEN 7 THEN 'Saterday'
       END
            WHEN 2 THEN num
    END AS num,
    mem_usage AS "Memory Usage"
FROM (
    SELECT DISTINCT
        CASE $period_id
            WHEN 1
               THEN to_char(time, 'D')
            WHEN 2
              THEN to_char(time, 'HH24:00') 
        END AS num,
        AVG ( MEM_Usage ) AS mem_usage
    --    AVG ( MEM_Peak ) AS mem_peak
    FROM (
        -- Here we get the hosts Max and Average CPU Usage Peaks
        SELECT
            history_datetime AS time,
            SUM (
                COALESCE (
                    memory_usage_percent,
                    0
                ) *
                COALESCE (
                    minutes_in_status,
                    0
                )
            ) /
            SUM (
                COALESCE (
                    minutes_in_status,
                    0
                )
            ) AS MEM_Usage,
            SUM (
                COALESCE (
                    max_memory_usage,
                    0
                ) *
                COALESCE (
                    minutes_in_status,
                    0
                )
            ) /
            SUM (
                COALESCE (
                    minutes_in_status,
                    0
                )
            ) AS MEM_Peak
        FROM
           (
            SELECT * FROM v4_3_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_hourly
            UNION
            SELECT * FROM v4_3_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_daily
           ) AS hourly_daily
        WHERE
            -- Here we filter by active hosts only
            hourly_daily.host_status = 1
            -- Here we filter by the host chosen by the user
            AND hourly_daily.host_id in ($host_id)
            AND history_datetime >= $__timeFrom()
            AND history_datetime < $__timeTo()
        GROUP BY
            history_datetime
    ) AS a
    GROUP BY
        CASE $period_id
            WHEN 1
               THEN to_char(time, 'D')
            WHEN 2
              THEN to_char(time, 'HH24:00') 
        END
    ORDER BY
        CASE $period_id
            WHEN 1
               THEN to_char(time, 'D')
            WHEN 2
              THEN to_char(time, 'HH24:00') 
        END ASC
) AS b

panels.title: Average Memory Usage (BR2C)

panels.description: This report contains charts displaying resources usage measurements (Number of Virtual Machines, CPU, Memory, Network Tx/Rx) for a selected host over the selected period.

targets.rawSql:
-- BR2C - This query returns the hourly hosts
-- Max and Average Memory Usage Peaks by hour of day and day of week

SELECT
    now() AS time,
    CASE $period_id
        WHEN 1 THEN 
        CASE CAST(num AS int)
            WHEN 1 THEN 'Sunday'
            WHEN 2 THEN 'Monday'
            WHEN 3 THEN 'Tuesday'
            WHEN 4 THEN 'Wednesday'
            WHEN 5 THEN'Thursday'
            WHEN 6 THEN 'Friday'
            WHEN 7 THEN 'Saterday'
       END
            WHEN 2 THEN num
    END AS num,
    mem_peak AS "Memory Usage Peaks"
FROM (
    SELECT DISTINCT
        CASE $period_id
            WHEN 1
               THEN to_char(time, 'D')
            WHEN 2
              THEN to_char(time, 'HH24:00') 
        END AS num,
    --    AVG ( MEM_Usage ) AS mem_usage
        AVG ( MEM_Peak ) AS mem_peak
    FROM (
        -- Here we get the hosts Max and Average CPU Usage Peaks
        SELECT
            history_datetime AS time,
            SUM (
                COALESCE (
                    memory_usage_percent,
                    0
                ) *
                COALESCE (
                    minutes_in_status,
                    0
                )
            ) /
            SUM (
                COALESCE (
                    minutes_in_status,
                    0
                )
            ) AS MEM_Usage,
            SUM (
                COALESCE (
                    max_memory_usage,
                    0
                ) *
                COALESCE (
                    minutes_in_status,
                    0
                )
            ) /
            SUM (
                COALESCE (
                    minutes_in_status,
                    0
                )
            ) AS MEM_Peak
        FROM v4_3_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_hourly
        WHERE
            -- Here we filter by active hosts only
            v4_3_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_hourly.host_status = 1
            -- Here we filter by the host chosen by the user
            AND v4_3_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_hourly.host_id in ($host_id)
            AND history_datetime >= $__timeFrom()
            AND history_datetime < $__timeTo()
        GROUP BY
            history_datetime
    ) AS a
    GROUP BY
        CASE $period_id
            WHEN 1
               THEN to_char(time, 'D')
            WHEN 2
              THEN to_char(time, 'HH24:00') 
        END
    ORDER BY
        CASE $period_id
            WHEN 1
               THEN to_char(time, 'D')
            WHEN 2
              THEN to_char(time, 'HH24:00') 
        END ASC
) AS b

panels.title: Memory Usage Peaks (BR2C)
Host Interfatce Rx and Tx Usage

panels.description: This report contains charts displaying resources usage measurements (Number of Virtual Machines, CPU, Memory, Network Tx/Rx) for a selected host over the selected period.

targets.rawSql:
-- BR2C - This query returns top 3 busiest
-- Ethernet Interface Tx and Rx Rates, by hour of day and day of week

SELECT
    now() AS time,
    CASE $period_id
        WHEN 1 THEN 
        CASE CAST(num AS int)
            WHEN 1 THEN 'Sunday'
            WHEN 2 THEN 'Monday'
            WHEN 3 THEN 'Tuesday'
            WHEN 4 THEN 'Wednesday'
            WHEN 5 THEN'Thursday'
            WHEN 6 THEN 'Friday'
            WHEN 7 THEN 'Saterday'
       END
            WHEN 2 THEN num
    END AS num,
    Tx_rate
FROM (
    SELECT DISTINCT
        CASE $period_id
            WHEN 1
               THEN to_char(time, 'D')
            WHEN 2
              THEN to_char(time, 'HH24:00') 
        END AS num,
     --   AVG ( Rx_rate ) AS Rx_rate,
        AVG ( Tx_rate ) AS Tx_rate
    FROM (
        SELECT
            v4_3_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces.host_interface_id,
            CASE
                WHEN delete_date IS NULL
                    THEN
                        v4_3_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces.host_interface_name
                ELSE
                    v4_3_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces.host_interface_name
                    ||
                    '*'
            END AS interface_name,
            statistics.history_datetime AS time,
            AVG (
                COALESCE ( receive_rate_percent, 0 )
            ) AS Rx_rate,
            AVG (
                COALESCE ( transmit_rate_percent, 0 )
            ) AS Tx_rate
        FROM
            (
            SELECT * FROM v4_3_statistics_hosts_interfaces_resources_usage_hourly
            UNION
            SELECT * FROM v4_3_statistics_hosts_interfaces_resources_usage_daily
            ) AS statistics
            INNER JOIN v4_3_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces
                ON (
                    v4_3_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces.host_interface_id =
                    statistics.host_interface_id
                )
        WHERE
            -- Here we filter by the host chosen by the user
            v4_3_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces.host_id in ($host_id)
            AND history_datetime >= $__timeFrom()
            AND history_datetime < $__timeTo()
            AND v4_3_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces.history_id IN (
                SELECT MAX ( a.history_id )
                FROM v4_3_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces AS a
                GROUP BY a.host_interface_id
            )
            AND v4_3_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces.host_interface_id IN (
                SELECT c.host_interface_id
                FROM
                    (
                    SELECT * FROM v4_3_statistics_hosts_interfaces_resources_usage_hourly
                    UNION
                    SELECT * FROM v4_3_statistics_hosts_interfaces_resources_usage_daily
                    ) AS b
                    INNER JOIN v4_3_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces c
                        ON (
                            c.host_interface_id = b.host_interface_id
                        )
                    INNER JOIN
                        (
                         SELECT * FROM v4_3_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_hourly
                         UNION
                         SELECT * FROM v4_3_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_daily
                        ) AS e
                        ON (
                            e.history_datetime = b.history_datetime
                            AND
                            e.host_id in ($host_id)
                        )
                WHERE
                    -- Here we filter by active hosts only
                    e.host_status = 1
                    AND c.host_id in ($host_id)
                    AND b.history_datetime >= $__timeFrom()
                    AND b.history_datetime < $__timeTo()
                    AND c.history_id IN (
                        SELECT MAX ( d.history_id )
                        FROM v4_3_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces AS d
                        GROUP BY d.host_interface_id
                    )
                    -- Here we get or remove deleted VM devices according to what the user chose
                    -- in the "show_deleted" parameter
                    AND
                      CASE
                        WHEN '$show_deleted'='Yes'
                          THEN 1=1
                        WHEN '$show_deleted'='No'
                          THEN delete_date isnull
                      END
                GROUP BY c.host_interface_id
                ORDER BY
                    AVG (
                        COALESCE ( b.receive_rate_percent, 0 )
                    ) +
                    AVG (
                        COALESCE ( b.transmit_rate_percent, 0 )
                    ) DESC
                LIMIT 3
            )
            -- Here we get or remove deleted VM devices according to what the user chose
            -- in the "show_deleted" parameter
            AND
              CASE
                WHEN '$show_deleted'='Yes'
                  THEN 1=1
                WHEN '$show_deleted'='No'
                  THEN delete_date isnull
              END
        GROUP BY
            v4_3_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces.host_interface_id,
            interface_name,
            statistics.history_datetime
    ) AS a
    GROUP BY
        CASE $period_id
            WHEN 1
               THEN to_char(time, 'D')
            WHEN 2
              THEN to_char(time, 'HH24:00') 
        END
    ORDER BY
        CASE $period_id
            WHEN 1
               THEN to_char(time, 'D')
            WHEN 2
              THEN to_char(time, 'HH24:00') 
        END ASC
) AS b

panels.title: Network Interface Transmit Rate (BR2C)

panels.description: This report contains charts displaying resources usage measurements (Number of Virtual Machines, CPU, Memory, Network Tx/Rx) for a selected host over the selected period.

targets.rawSql:
-- BR2C - This query returns top 3 busiest
-- Ethernet Interface Tx and Rx Rates, by hour of day and day of week

SELECT
    now() AS time,
    CASE $period_id
        WHEN 1 THEN 
        CASE CAST(num AS int)
            WHEN 1 THEN 'Sunday'
            WHEN 2 THEN 'Monday'
            WHEN 3 THEN 'Tuesday'
            WHEN 4 THEN 'Wednesday'
            WHEN 5 THEN'Thursday'
            WHEN 6 THEN 'Friday'
            WHEN 7 THEN 'Saterday'
       END
            WHEN 2 THEN num
    END AS num,
    Rx_rate
FROM (
    SELECT DISTINCT
        CASE $period_id
            WHEN 1
               THEN to_char(time, 'D')
            WHEN 2
              THEN to_char(time, 'HH24:00') 
        END AS num,
        AVG ( Rx_rate ) AS Rx_rate
     --   AVG ( Tx_rate ) AS Tx_rate
    FROM (
        SELECT
            v4_3_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces.host_interface_id,
            CASE
                WHEN delete_date IS NULL
                    THEN
                        v4_3_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces.host_interface_name
                ELSE
                    v4_3_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces.host_interface_name
                    ||
                    '*'
            END AS interface_name,
            statistics.history_datetime AS time,
            AVG (
                COALESCE ( receive_rate_percent, 0 )
            ) AS Rx_rate,
            AVG (
                COALESCE ( transmit_rate_percent, 0 )
            ) AS Tx_rate
        FROM
            (
            SELECT * FROM v4_3_statistics_hosts_interfaces_resources_usage_hourly
            UNION
            SELECT * FROM v4_3_statistics_hosts_interfaces_resources_usage_daily
            ) AS statistics
            INNER JOIN v4_3_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces
                ON (
                    v4_3_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces.host_interface_id =
                    statistics.host_interface_id
                )
        WHERE
            -- Here we filter by the host chosen by the user
            v4_3_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces.host_id in ($host_id)
            AND history_datetime >= $__timeFrom()
            AND history_datetime < $__timeTo()
            AND v4_3_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces.history_id IN (
                SELECT MAX ( a.history_id )
                FROM v4_3_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces AS a
                GROUP BY a.host_interface_id
            )
            AND v4_3_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces.host_interface_id IN (
                SELECT c.host_interface_id
                FROM
                    (
                    SELECT * FROM v4_3_statistics_hosts_interfaces_resources_usage_hourly
                    UNION
                    SELECT * FROM v4_3_statistics_hosts_interfaces_resources_usage_daily
                    ) AS b
                    INNER JOIN v4_3_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces c
                        ON (
                            c.host_interface_id = b.host_interface_id
                        )
                    INNER JOIN
                        (
                         SELECT * FROM v4_3_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_hourly
                         UNION
                         SELECT * FROM v4_3_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_daily
                        ) AS e
                        ON (
                            e.history_datetime = b.history_datetime
                            AND
                            e.host_id in ($host_id)
                        )
                WHERE
                    -- Here we filter by active hosts only
                    e.host_status = 1
                    AND c.host_id in ($host_id)
                    AND b.history_datetime >= $__timeFrom()
                    AND b.history_datetime < $__timeTo()
                    AND c.history_id IN (
                        SELECT MAX ( d.history_id )
                        FROM v4_3_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces AS d
                        GROUP BY d.host_interface_id
                    )
                    -- Here we get or remove deleted VM devices according to what the user chose
                    -- in the "show_deleted" parameter
                    AND
                      CASE
                        WHEN '$show_deleted'='Yes'
                          THEN 1=1
                        WHEN '$show_deleted'='No'
                          THEN delete_date isnull
                      END
                GROUP BY c.host_interface_id
                ORDER BY
                    AVG (
                        COALESCE ( b.receive_rate_percent, 0 )
                    ) +
                    AVG (
                        COALESCE ( b.transmit_rate_percent, 0 )
                    ) DESC
                LIMIT 3
            )
            -- Here we get or remove deleted VM devices according to what the user chose
            -- in the "show_deleted" parameter
            AND
              CASE
                WHEN '$show_deleted'='Yes'
                  THEN 1=1
                WHEN '$show_deleted'='No'
                  THEN delete_date isnull
              END
        GROUP BY
            v4_3_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces.host_interface_id,
            interface_name,
            statistics.history_datetime
    ) AS a
    GROUP BY
        CASE $period_id
            WHEN 1
               THEN to_char(time, 'D')
            WHEN 2
              THEN to_char(time, 'HH24:00') 
        END
    ORDER BY
        CASE $period_id
            WHEN 1
               THEN to_char(time, 'D')
            WHEN 2
              THEN to_char(time, 'HH24:00') 
        END ASC
) AS b
